Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.common.util.property

Class GamePropertyLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.common.util.property.GamePropertyLoader
  • public class GamePropertyLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a utility class used to load the GameProperty from its location into the game.cfg file.
    See Also:
    GameProperty

      GameProperty loadGameProperties()
      Reads the GameProperty from the configuration file and returns a new instance of them after verifying that the read values verifies all the corresponding requirements and are, as a result, valid.

      • IGNORE_SEQUENCE

        private static final java.lang.String IGNORE_SEQUENCE
        The sequence of characters representing a start of line to be ignored. Any line starting with this exact sequence of characters will be interpreted as a comment and will be ignored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamePropertyLoader

        public GamePropertyLoader()
        This is the only constructor. It creates a new GamePropertyLoader and initiate the scanner in order to read the configuration file.

    • Method Detail

      • loadGameProperties

        public GameProperty loadGameProperties()
                                throws InvalidPropertyException
        Reads the GameProperty from the configuration file and returns a new instance of them after verifying that the read values verifies all the corresponding requirements and are, as a result, valid.
        Returns:
        the GameProperty read from the configuration file.
        Throws:
        InvalidPropertyException - if some properties does not verify the corresponding requirements.

        Parameters:
        description - the String representation of the finalFrenzy property.
        Returns:
        the corresponding finalFrenzy property.
        Throws:
        InvalidPropertyException - if the corresponding requirements are not satisfied.

      • getIntegerProperty

        private int getIntegerProperty​(java.lang.String description,
                               java.lang.String propertyName,
                               int lowerBound,
                               int upperBound)
                        throws InvalidPropertyException
        Returns the integer value corresponding to the given String representation, after verifying that the given description satisfies all the corresponding requirements.
        Parameters:
        description - the String representation of the requested property.
        propertyName - the String sequence to refer to the given property.
        lowerBound - the minimum value accepted for the given property.
        upperBound - the maximum value accepted for the given property.
        Returns:
        the property corresponding to the given description.
        Throws:
        InvalidPropertyException - if the corresponding requirements are not satisfied.
